title: Bethany
summary: Bethany (Greek: Βηθανία;[2] Hebrew: בֵּית עַנְיָה‎) or what is locally known as Al-Eizariya or al-Azariya (Arabic: العيزرية‎, "(place) of Lazarus"), is a town in the West Bank. The name al-Eizariya refers to the New Testament figure Lazarus of Bethany, who according to the Gospel of John, was raised from the dead by Jesus.[3]  The traditional site of the miracle, the Tomb of Lazarus, in the city is a place of pilgrimage.
